column5: Notes
If allies are a viable deck, this goes up in value significantly.
Great waterbending card.
These usually play well at 4 mana--one more mana for a clue and one deeper in the deck is alright, but probably makes this worse than a 4 mana version.
If there is a deck that wants to sacrifice permanents this gets better, but that's not a huge archetype from what I see so far.
These always end up playing better than I expect, so...
Inconsistent on the thoughtsieze effect.
Needs other modified support, which is on a few black cards but not too many yet. Works with firebending though.
Great with firebending.
While this card would normally be bad, all red instants go up considerably in a set with firebending.
Phenomenal use of art. And also a good card!
Good for allies.
Only on enter, only if you attack, a 4/2. Yikes.
Could go into a firebending deck, but otherwise incredibly bad.
Fanatic of Rhonas at home!
Mana sinks generally play well in limited even when they are expensive/overcosted. With firebending, mana sinks get even better.
Can be double ramp if you sacrifice an earthbent land, but then you're sacrificing a creature, so...
Kevin's favorite card that never fails him.
Sideboard card against fliers I guess.
A tapped 4/4 on turn 4. Eh, but all the bending and lesson synergies seem promising, so being both pushes it up a little bit.
Card that makes two creatures--usually good. Even better if +1/+1 counters are a thing.
If lessons are an important archetype, this becomes much better. Instant speed is also quite good--firebending and control decks alike can use this.
If there's a graveyard deck maybe. Hybrid pips are usually a plus.
3 mana is a lot for a 1/2 flier.
Often a 4/4 reach trampler.
You need to worry less about the where, and more about the going.
A good effect, but 5 mana is a little expensive. A good common airbending target if you want to hit your own creatures with it.
Common dual lands are always good.
Basics don't get rated, but here we are. I guess by definition they have to be a C? You should probably remove these from the calculations.
Lmao loving the lands with random creature keywords to earthbend. Very cute.
Fixing in a pinch. And bad removal (but can be done at instant speed).
Fixing is usually good or at least necessary in limited. Not sure yet if that shrine text will be impactful, but if so, essentially a four mana draw two in colorless, so...
If you can use mana on your opponents turn, this is a pretty good three mana mana rock.
5 mana and instant speed--will actually probably be pretty alright.
What a power crept one mana trick.
Never underestimate a 1/1 flier for one mana.
Resolute reinforcements, but double ally. Great with waterbending, airbending, and firebending. This can go in so many decks
O-ring effects on creatures are usually easier to remove. But a 3/3 body in the meantime is fine.
3 mana bounce something of an opponents plus an equipment. Good for tempo, but equipment are usually bad in limited.

Ughhh the flexibility is nice, but usually these enchantments that don't otherwise affect the board state play pretty badly. Especially if this is a pretty aggro format like I suspect firebending might push it.
A flying Manowar, probably pretty good.

A wrath type effect at uncommon? Maybe this is something that will tamp down on the aggro leanings firebending would push. Though in the early game this won't be removing much and your opponents get to choose. Probably a sideboard card.
There are no shrines at common, so I'm skeptical that a shrine deck will be that viable regularly in draft.
Hmm a little underwhelming for 4 mana at uncommon.
Monocolor payoffs? Interesting, but rarely will you be monocolor in limited, so this might be like 5 mana make 3 1/1s and scry 2. Not that good.
6 mana is a lot in limited, but the flexibility is pretty good. It's hard to not to give him extra points for being best boy tho.
One mana bounce is a pretty big tempo play. Even though sorcery is a drawback
Oof don't love that this also ramps your opponent. But it is only 1 mana.
If you can get enough things down early, I like this card as long as it's 5 mana or less. But that does likely mean tapping your creatures.
2 mana three stun counters. Might be a sideboard card against aggro. Or a late game play to push through damage. Is 5 mana tap and stun three things good? It's a pretty strong tempo play.
So many upsides here for a two mana creature. Waterbending with it's vigilance and clue token.
The lesson mill is most likely flavor text from what I can tell so far, but a 2 mana creature with prowess isn't bad.

Another monocolor payoff, which usually isn't where you end up in limited. It does just sit around for waterbending until you might use this in the late game, but that's probably not what you want to do with 2 mana.
Another Manowar! Can waterbend itself for its own ability.
A creature that continues to grow is pretty good. And 6 mana to draw a card as a mana sink is also not bad.
Again, I just don't think there are enough shrines to make this work in limited. This also doesn't work with waterbending either.
Flying connive is good. 1/4 for 4 is not, though.
Welcome to flavortown, baby! But very situational.
Counter spell plus draw is usually good, but holding up five mana could be tough. Gets better with instant speed mana sinks in the deck.
Tolarian Terror at the Earth King's home.
Just not enough shrines I think.
Instant speed reanimation plus flexibility and works with firebending.
Always trading up.
Emotional damage. A 2 mana 4/4 is good, but you have to hold up the 2 mana and hope your opponent removes your creature? A combat trick? If you have sacrifice maybe.
Damn even more emotional damage.
If you have a lot of clues sitting around, you could turn them into 2/2s I guess. Goes crazy with Soul Cauldron in Standard (though probably not a tier deck (hopefully)).
Turning creatures into clues is usually not as good.
Lmao a LOTR reprint basically. You have to be attacking consistently. Good sac fodder.
Lmao the artist did not have to do that. Just saw clip of Voxy reacting to it haha.
A more realistic aggro counterplay card perhaps. Sideboard of course.
Is this bringing notes of Sneaky Snacker? Hold Kevin back.
Damn. Can be attacks you draw a card and lose a life. Or hold onto the clue for later. Pretty good.
4 mana 2/2. I mean this could be a Necrosquito and we all remember how unbeatable that card was.
But
column6: I'm Li...so who's banished?" I mean if there's a busted Lesson or Noble to tutor this could be good
column7: but otherwise damn it's a 5 mana 2/2."

column5: 7 mana is a lot, but this is the best of the monocolor payoffs so far.
Firebending can put that counter on.
Ceiling is very high.
At least is draws a nonland. Probably not casting it for free.
Not enough Shrines, but this does impact the board state so it's not the worst of them.
A lot of value, but slow.
Like sister, like brother.
Instant speed two 2/2s is already good, but flashback and working with firebending is very good.
A spell for later in the game, but fairly good then.
Ramp usually doesn't play as well in limited, but it's been a long time since we've had actual rampant growth in a limited format.
Getting rid of your creature to ramp only sounds good if it's dying on blocks.
Whoa usually this effect costs a lot more.
One of the better monocolor payoffs, but I'm still skeptical.
3 mana 2/3 plus 2/2. Quite good.
The Boulder is conflicted about fighting a young, blind girl.
Not the best overrun.
Really need to have at least 2 lessons for this to be worth it.
Great in a sacrifice deck.
Will be tough to hit off this.
Reminiscent of another good panda (FDN).
Adeline at Kyoshi's home.
Tougher to hit in limited.
Flavor win for the MTG x ATLA flavor.
Harder to do in limited
Might be a bit of win more.
A bit of difficult build around.
Better in constructed than limited.
If you get both, that's just game
A lot less consistent in limited, but it is pretty much endless value (until you mill out).
Playing with fire.
Doesn't seem like there's too much from exile synergy, but nice flavor win.
2/2 makes 2/2 and gives a food.
Uro (way) at Home

column1: Aang, Swift Savior // Aang and La, Ocean's Fury
Aang, at the Crossroads // Aang, Destined Savior

column5: Even better in constructed, still good here.

column1: Avatar Aang // Aang, Master of Elements
column5: Hard to cast, otherwise good.

The Legend of Roku // Avatar Roku
The Legend of Yangchen // Avatar Yangchen
The Legend of Kyoshi // Avatar Kyoshi
The Rise of Sozin // Fire Lord Sozin
The Walls of Ba Sing Se
